alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gates of the Mountains; Helena Valley; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 5:49AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Bands of snow and gusty northerly winds will impact much of Central and North-Central Montana through mid-morning... At 546 AM MST, moderate to heavy snow bands and northerly winds gusting up to 50 mph were moving through North-central Montana. HAZARD...Snow and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility to less than a half mile and slippery roads. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Havre, Lewistown, Shelby, Cut Bank, Conrad, Choteau, Fort Benton, Chinook, Chester, Cascade, Big Sandy, Stanford, Browning, Harlem, Fairfield, Belt, Valier, Sunburst and Dutton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
